Hi all,

I am writing a few test cases to ensure that my code is throwing the 
right exception.

The following is my test case to catch the FileNotFoundException:

// Read from a non existing file
public void testReadResponseFrom_Non_Existing_File() {
  try {
    TestXMLProcessor testProcessor = new TestXMLProcessor();

    String sNonExistingFilename = "NonExisting.xml";  	  	
    testProcessor.readResponseFromFile(sNonExistingFilename);
  	  
  } catch (Exception e) {
    assertEquals(FileNotFoundException.class, e.getClass());
  }
}


How can I modify my code to use the "ExceptionTestCase" class from 
JUnit?  Can I use the "ExceptionTestCase" for catching exception 
during unit test?

Thanks in advance.
Donny
